org.jcatapult.mvc.parameter.el
Interface ExpressionEvaluator

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultExpressionEvaluator
public interface ExpressionEvaluator

This interface defines the mechanism by which expressions are evaluated in order to get values from Objects and set values from the HTTP request parameters into Objects.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Method Summary
 String expand(String str, Object object)
          Expands variables in the given String.
 Set<String> getAllMembers(Class<?> type)
          Retrieves all of the names of the members from the given class that can be accessed by the expression evaluator.

          Retrieves all of the values of the members from the given Object that can be accessed by the expression evaluator.

Method Detail

getValue

<T> T getValue(String expression,
               Object object)
           throws ExpressionException
Retrieves a value defined by the given expression from the given object.

Parameters:
expression - The expression that defines the value to get from the object.
object - The object to get the value from.
Returns:
The value from the object.
Throws:
ExpressionException - If the expression is invalid or there was an error during processing.

getValue

String getValue(String expression,
                Object object,
                Map<String,String> attributes)
                throws ExpressionException
Retrieves a value defined by the given expression from the given object and converts that value into a String using the appropriate GlobalConverter.

Parameters:
expression - The expression that defines the value to get from the object.
object - The object to get the value from.
attributes - The attributes for the expression. These attributes are only available if the user submitted a form and a particular parameter had some attributes associated with it. Those attributes are stored in the HttpServletRequest and can be fetched via the ParameterWorkflow. These are passed to the Converter to assist in coversion from objects to Strings.
Returns:
The String value from the object. This value has been converted.
Throws:
ExpressionException - If the expression is invalid or there was an error during processing.

setValue

void setValue(String expression,
              Object object,
              Object value)
              throws ExpressionException
Sets the given value into the given object using the given expression.

Parameters:
expression - The expression.
object - The object.
value - The value to set into the object.
Throws:
ExpressionException - If the expression is invalid or there was an error during processing.

setValue

void setValue(String expression,
              Object object,
              String[] values,
              Map<String,String> attributes)
              throws ConversionException,
                     ConverterStateException,
                     ExpressionException
Sets the given values into the given object using the given expression. The values given are taken directly from the HttpServletRequest parameters. This performs any necessary conversions from the String[] values to the type required by the expression and object given. Conversions are done by the appropriate GlobalConverter.

Parameters:
expression - The expression.
object - The object.
values - The HttpServletRequest parameter values.
attributes - The attributes for the expression. These attributes are only available if the user submitted a form and a particular parameter had some attributes associated with it. Those attributes are stored in the HttpServletRequest and can be fetched via the ParameterWorkflow. These are passed to the Converter to assist in coversion from objects to Strings.
Throws:
ConversionException - If the conversion failed.
ConverterStateException - If there isn't a converter or the converter could not run because it was missing a required attribute.
ExpressionException - If the expression is invalid or there was an error during processing.

expand

String expand(String str,
              Object object)
              throws ExpressionException
Expands variables in the given String. The variables must be in the form ${foo}.

Parameters:
str - The String to expand.
object - The Root object where the variables are expanded from.
Returns:
The expanded String and never null.
Throws:
ExpressionException - If the expansion failed.

getAllMembers

Set<String> getAllMembers(Class<?> type)
Retrieves all of the names of the members from the given class that can be accessed by the expression evaluator.

Parameters:
type - The class to retrieve the members from.
Returns:
The list of member names.

getAllMemberValues

Collection<Object> getAllMemberValues(Object obj)
Retrieves all of the values of the members from the given Object that can be accessed by the expression evaluator.

Parameters:
obj - The Object to retrieve the values from.
Returns:
The list of member values.
